alert.note: Alert for Lower St. Bernard (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 7:51PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm capable of producing waterspouts will affect marshy ares of far eastern St. Bernard Parish through 830 PM CDT... At 749 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspouts over the marshy areas of far eastern St. Bernard Parish. The storm was located 11 miles northeast of Shell Beach, or 23 miles south of Waveland, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 25 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous conditions. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern St. Bernard Parish. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Any boaters in the area should seek safe harbor.
